title: Great concept + great food
text: Love this concept! And the food I got in my first order was delicious. You have to understand you are getting the extras or the leftovers, so it might not look perfect or have just been cooked in the last 30 minutes. But you still get delicious food at an amazing price! Thanks to the developers, this is a great way to keep good food out of the trash and make it more affordable.

title: Not really about reducing food waste
text: Whether you’re actually reducing food waste is dubious. Nonetheless, I thoroughly enjoy this app. It’s pushed me to go and explore so many new places and at discounted price. I would say though that you’re rarely getting what’s leftover, and it’s more like an advertising arrangement to get a discounted first try at their place. But of course you can go again and again.

title: Great idea
text: I just downloaded this and it’s such a great idea. Want to make it better? How about a map so I can see what’s available nearby (in a big place like NY, I don’t want to go all over town for food). Currently you don’t know where the place is until you click on it and this gets tedious (and yes I did set my location but it shows me restaurants all over the city). Also, letting users sort food by diet preferences would be good.

title: Fake store accounts?
text:
I placed an order at a local pizzeria. My pick up time was tonight between 9-10pm. I show up around 9:10 and the place is closed. A worker sees me through the window and notifies me they’re closed. I mention my order and the app and he looks at it and mentions that he never heard of the app and they don’t do app orders.

Not sure if the pizzeria is messing with me or the app incorrectly set up this store.

title: App is good but not the Retailers
text: I think this app is created for a noble idea.  But of the 3 retailers I tried, 2 out of 3 simply is not worth the buy.  It looks like some retailers are using this app to create more Sales than what it was for.  Raised by the Lions promoted $3.99 for $12 worth of “old” pastry…what I received was a piece of banana cake and a croissant.  Will that cost $12 even if is fresh?  You do the math.  I would suggest this app published all the reviews rather than hide it from users.

title: So Worth it!!
text: As a environmental health conscious college student it feels great to decrease food waste. I work a part time minimum wage job and pay rent so I often find myself being frugal as I cook all my meals. TooGoodToGo has provided me with a variety of fresh produce from Hard Rock Cafe and 2 meals from chaia tacos. I am so grateful! My only complaint is that I wish more restaurants in the D.C. area were apart of this program to reach more people.

title: I love this app!
text: It was recommended to me a couple months ago and ever since downloading it I have saved hundreds of dollars. Saving food from going to waste is amazing as well. I’ve tried so many new places that I regularly go to now thanks to this app. It’s even become a huge hit at work. Half the office is now using it almost daily. Can’t recommend this app enough.

title: Expand Locations
text: I am giving this app 5 stars because I think this Is a phenomenal idea and have seen people on TikTok use it with success and I do not want to hinder the reviews with lower stars. However this service is only available in very limited locations. I really wish it would expand to Chicagoland because I would love to use it and help out the planet as well as my wallet.

title: Great concept
text: Love the concept and the app works well. The only problem is that when you select the area of interest on the map, you can only use a perfect circle to choose the relevant zone. It would be much more practical where I live to be able to freely design the area of interest because of the mountains and the proximity to an island only reachable by ferry. Even though they are close, they are impractical to reach.

title: Helpful and useful!
text: So this app has actually been really cool. I highly encourage y’all to check it out. It’s basically local restaurants and smaller grocery stores putting together surprise bags of their food for super cheap. It can be hit or miss if you’re a super picky eater but otherwise it’s a fantastic deal and helps cut down on food waste. I’ve gotten a lot of use out of it in DFW.

title: TGTG in Glendale
text:
I have the app for 2-3 weeks already and i live the concept. My first order was from Laduree in Americana and i loved it. I got a huge croissant and a slice of chocolate cake for 4.99+tax=5.50$. For Laduree thats a great deal. 

The only con is not being able to leave a review on the app. Everyone of us will be glad to have an option to write a review and read others reviews before buying

title: EBT suggestion
text: I just started using this app and I really love it!! I’ve gotten two surprise bags so far and they were both super good and a lot of food. I just wanted to make one suggestion that you also make it accessible for folks to pay via EBT (food stamps) and give a discount for people using them, so that those most acutely hit by food insecurity can access this.

title: It’s really too good to go
text: My son, is it just me to the app and I’ve been using it every since keep up the good work and God bless your endure . And I wish you much much success. You open those people like me that’s on disability get a chance in life to eat great food. With the cost of food supply again God bless you and your franchise. I think all of you from the bottom of my heart.

title: Good Eats For All
text: I like that people and food service businesses are conscious of wasting food and huge increase of methane gases that are released into the environment. Saving food that you would throw away is a good thing that needs to be considered by everyone. To save a meal at a reduced price is excellent and cost effective for business owners and customers.  This idea introduces consumers to different ethnic foods and saves  food from garbage landfills.

title: Very poorly managed
text: I purchased a surprise bag for a business that wasn’t even open at the time. I arrived to find the business closed for remodeling. Why even offer a product for sale if the business is closed? Two days later, I received a recommendation that I purchase another surprise bag from the same business that was still closed. My wife purchased a surprise bag from a bakery. Upon her arrival, she was told they had no idea what she was talking about. She even showed her receipt as proof of purchase and no one was interested in helping her out. Great app if you want to waste your time and gas.

title: LOVE IT!!!!
text: I’ve never written a review for an app, until this one. This is such a great app, I wish I had known about it sooner!!! Not only does it give a solution to food waste, but it saves you money, and you get to discover new food places that you might have not gone to, because you weren’t sure how it’ll be. I 100% whole heartedly recommend this app to anyone and everyone!!!

title: Notifications
text:
I cannot get notifications to work.  I think if I’ve marked a favorite restaurant, when that restaurant offers a meal I’d get a notification. That is not happening.  I only get notifications when it is time to pick up an order.  

Is it a user error or does the notifications system within the app work differently than I expected?

title: Preventing waste of yummy foods!
text: This has been a fun way to try new foods at restaurants, bakeries, etc. that I have never tried. Unfortunately, many of my favorites always sell out at times when I am asleep or at work. I have even set timers to try to get some of the deals, but I still miss out. Maybe some people are using some sort of app or bot to get them? 🥲

title: Where’s all the food?
text: If you can survive solely on donuts, you will love this app. I bought a “surprise box” from one of five donut shops in my “12 mile radius” and guess what I got? Nine donuts and 4 donut holes. $6 at Donut Shop in Huntington Beach. Please add some restaurants in this area around Anaheim/Buena Park/Brea. You would have infinitely more luck dumpster diving in this current area than using their app. Great idea though, thumbs up for effort! 👍🏼🍩🍩🍩

title: LOVE IT
text: There used to be no restaurants that participated in my area. I decided to revisit the app and now there are a handful. I absolutely love it! This is an amazing idea. I choose restaurants with four out of five stars at the least and my experience so far has been wonderful.  There are great prices, a generous amount of food and you are saving food waste. I hope more and more restaurants join.

title: What a steal!
text:
Only been using this for a few days and LOVING it. Got some entrees from my favorite restaurant that came out at less than $2 per meal and some delicious pastries that were just a dollar each. 
I hardly ever go out to eat because of the expense, but this will probably change that. I feel so lucky every time I pick something up I’ve ordered with this app. YUM!

title: Finally I can help clean up NYCs streets AND save a pretty penny!
text: I have been following this company waiting for it to launch in NYC and I’m so excited! I’ve already saved 3 meals and can’t wait to keep saving more. nYC has a huge food waste problem, on top of the ridiculous prices of food. Too Good To Go solves both problems for busy New Yorkers. The app is super simple and intuitive. I already shared it with all my friends!

title: Expected more food
text: I was really excited to use this app and I tried a lot of places but overall I expected more food. We definitely got food at a discounted price but it’s not worth it to have to travel to the place and not even know what you’re getting. The food I was given was probably only worth a couple dollars less at retail price than what I paid, so in my opinion not worth paying almost the same price but not being able to choose what to get. Every place I went to only gave me a couple items.

title: Only for omnivores
text: I love the premise of this app so freaking much and I can’t use it.  I just open it and stare in frustration, then close it again.  I have no way to know whether I could eat some or none of any given bag of food.  The prices are so cheap, but my time & energy (and especially my travel & exposure as the pandemic ramps up again) aren’t.  I live in a city with so many participating restaurants – this will be a 5 star, very frequent-use app for me if it ever adds a vegetarian option.

title: Issues on 25% of Ordera
text: 1 in 4 orders there is an issue. Either the restaurant is closed at the time of pickup, the staff is unaware that they’re even listed on the platform, the restaurant allows you to order but then tells you there is nothing to pickup when you arrive, etc.  TooGoodToGo is a great concept in theory but poorly executed in reality. Definitely don’t rely on this app regularly for food; if anything it’s better as a mere supplement to your existing routine.

title: Great service
text:
I’m really grateful for, and impressed by this app.,, currently on a unpaid leave of absence from work due to health reasons, and being able to get healthy food at a great discount is extremely helpful. Thank you!
Unfortunately, there aren’t any participating businesses in my immediate area- closest ones are 10+ miles away… please recruit more businesses in the Amesbury/Haverhill/Methuen area:)

title: Cool concept
text: We love supporting this idea. Always fun not knowing what exactly we are getting. That’s half the fun. Reminds me of the “$1 Grab Bag” at the county fair in 1978. Thr food we have ever received was top quality, good assortment and still fresh to enjoy that night. And can’t beat the deal. It’s like take out for 1/4 of the price. Only downside is I wish the MainLine of Philadelphia had more participating restaurants.

title: Try this all just for fun!
text: I really like this app! The food isn’t alwYs too my taste and when it comes to baked goods you can definitely tell the bread or pastry has been sitting out for a while. But the prices are super great value and cheap why not! Also, BEST PART!! No additional fees! If it says $3.99 it really is $3.99. This is one of those apps that makes you mad you didn’t invent it yourself!

title: This needs to generally be a better value
text: I was very excited to get on this app. And I have had a few deals that are pretty good value, like a dozen fresh bagels for six dollars and a big container of soup and then a good size container of noodles for six dollars. But a lot of these places seem to be using this out to only slightly discount their food so that they can get people in to the store. I have had way too many orders of older baked goods where I was paying at least a dollar an item.

title: El Huipil and app To go
text:
Awesome experience!! I just learned about this app yesterday from friends. We thought we would try it, thinking it’s almost too good to be true. The fact that we were “saving a meal” is a great thing- but the meal was so delicious!! Everything was very fresh, hot and plentiful from El Huipil in Acton. 
We will certainly go back there, and, I have a lot of gratitude for this app. Thank you!! Jim and Holly.

title: Middle Village Bagels
text: My friends in Middle Village have been raving about this place. I’m a Bagel snob, but decided to give it a try after seeing lines out the door.  By far the best bagels in Queens. Broadest selection, and the friendliest people. I used to go to a place in Forest Hills where they acted like they were doing me a favor taking my money. No more. I found MY PLACE. Congratulations to the owners on winning me over!

title: Deleted immediately
text:
As other reviews have stated, it keeps asking you to complete your profile (DOB, gender, etc) regardless of how many times you’ve already completed it. 

Also, the only places within 10 miles of me (Dallas, TX) are donut shops & bakeries. It asked about dietary restrictions in the account setup but doesn’t allow me to search/filter by them & doesn’t specify what offers may include such items.

App seems worthless to me so I immediately deleted it. Love the concept though. Maybe DoorDash or Uber Eats could offer delivery?

title: A few glitches . Overall works well .
text: I would like more information on the type of store and what types of goods they carry . Unable to edit my profile like email info . Is also not user friendly when it comes to looking up other areas besides your current location .

title: Fun Adventure
text: I tried this app with my kids and we had a great time.  Not only did we get tasty treats but a chance to talk about ways to tackle food waste.  I was very impressed with the efficiency and how welcoming the staff/business were.  I would be happy to frequent these places in other capacities now that I know they are taking steps support this initiative on food waste.

title: First try - restaurant closed.
text:
First time using this app - got to the restaurant right on time and it was closed. Nice idea but really not worth the hassle since it sounds from other reviews like this team is not able to keep track of which restaurants are actually open and which ones aren’t.

Update - comment below said to contact them through the app and they would address the issue ‘right away.’ I did exactly this while standing in front of the store. It took them four days (from Saturday night to Wednesday) to reply to me and provide a refund. Guess we have different definitions of ‘right away’.

title: Helps if you’re a carb fiend
text: Not bad, great idea. Some of the deals wind up being kind of whatever (got a falafel with a drink for the price of a falafel, in one case... not much of a surprise) but some are good. But note that a majority of places are bakeries or cafe/pastry shops... so most of what you’ll find is breads and pastries. Which makes sense, because that’s what can’t be sold the next day. If you’re doing the low-carb thing, you might not find much to choose from most nights.

title: Great idea. Needs fixing!
text: I downloaded this app and set up my profile. I set up notifications and I receive nothing about availability for new surprise bags. I even favorited a couple stores and that doesn’t make a difference! This needs to be fixed! I’m either too early or too late. People buy these up almost instantly and it gets sold out in minutes. I’m not sure if the system is rigged, but there should be a limit to how many each customer can purchase per release of new surprise bags.

title: Needs more notification settings
text: Go to a store once and the app will continue to send you daily notifications about it months later. There is no way to turn these off except for to turn off notifications entirely. But that means you won't get reminders to go pick up your food when you do reserve a bag somewhere else. Very annoying and poor user experience. I should be able to turn notifications on/off per store and per feature (e.g. Pickup reminders, promotions, "save a bag", etc.)

title: Getting food for half the price!!
text: Sometimes my family wants food from a restaurant, and this is a cheap way of getting that type of food without breaking the bank. If you live by a pizzaria, bagel place, or a bakery, this is the app for you. Really zero down side (besides it not being healthy 😵 stay away if you are losing weight 💪)

title: Great idea just needs some changes
text: My main problem is a lot of my favorite restaurants that do sell surprise bags happen to be sold out almost instantly at times where I’m not checking the app, if possible I should be able to have notifications to tell me when surprise bags are available and be able to pick and choose which restaurants I want them from

title: Watch out they cancel orders
text: I was super excited to try this app but when I ordered they decided to cancel on me last minute because they ran out of food. I walked for 30 min in the blistering cold to the location only to find my order was cancelled on the app which I didn’t even know was possible. There was some weird delay in updating my order status and it only cancelled once I got to the location. Instead of writing this in tiny font in the bottom of the page somewhere a bigger warning would’ve saved 1 hour of my life...

title: Amazing food
text: I think this is such a great way to save food and I’m all about saving food from waste as a mother I try my hardest to save food from going to the garbage and I want to help the  my earth in every way possible. I loved the food I received today I will definitely keep getting my meal through too good to go and tell all my friends to get on this !!

title: Amazing!
text: This is such a great idea to battle food waste and our current recession! As an unemployed college student, I will definitely be using this. Unfortunately there’s none in either my home city or college city yet. Please come to Kansas City and Wichita! Especially Wichita because there is a VERY high homeless population and low-income households here, and this could benefit so many of them.

title: There’s only food 50% of the time
text: This app must remove their automatic function or whatever is causing stores to not have food but still having it stated that they have food. Only half of the places I go to have food. The other half is always an excuse that they forgot to cancel, don’t know how to, bla bla so I’ve waisted HOURS driving multiple locations just to not have any food left. It’s terrible. But if you cancel last minute they refuse to refund you but stores are able to just not have food ready? I’m going to stop using this app. Terrible. 0/5 stars.

title: In love
text: I can’t say enough good things about this app. I just moved to London and started using it and it’s so easy to use, and I’ve saved so much money on food already. I love that it’s a surprise and I get to try new things. I also love that I’m helping save food from being wasted. It’s seriously just a win all the way around. So happy I discovered this app.

title: Absolutely Phenomenal
text: I was so excited when I found out too good to go was now in my area! I’ve had delicious lunches for a price I can afford, and saved food that otherwise would otherwise not be eaten, it’s a win for me! All the pickups have been easy and I haven’t received anything I wasn’t happy about, I am so excited to keep using Too Good To Go

title: Great value also to test new places or foods
text: New to this but have tried 3 different locations. The food has been more than worth the price. The thing I like best is I’m also getting to try some different menu items I’ve never tried before, as well as some I have. Great also if you carry lunch the next day.

title: Poor customer service bad store experience
text: I upload this app because I liked the idea. But the store that I choose to place my order gave me expired food and I refused to take it, so stuff of the store turned to be extremely rude. I complained to the app customer service and requested refund, unfortunately nobody reply to my request. I would recommend to think twice before you pick the store to place your order and check reviews. Plus, don’t relay on the support of the app, they are not very helpful and be prepared to get bad food with no option to get your money back!

title: Perfect win win - helps planet while allowing us to save
text: I work in the food industry and it’s crazy how much food gets wasted (50%!) at the consumer’s plate. This app has been an incredible way for me to help reduce food waste - biggest contributor of climate change - while staying under budget eating out. So so thankful and will continue to use every day

title: Welp
text:
This is a great app but the program needs work.  The last two times I tried to use it were failures.  The first one was a coffee shop downtown.  I drove 15 mins out of my way to find the store closed even though I was well within my pick up time.  Again today I showed up 20 mins into a 2 hour pick up window and they were closed.  
Driving 20 mins for nothing seems like it negates the idea of the program, and while they are great about refunds, I am still out the gas and time.
